intro: Oxypolis filiformis var. canbyi, commonly known as the slender oxypolis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and clusters of small, often pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are often pink or white, and it is known for its ability to thrive in arid environments. This variety is particularly adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy plant in xerophytic landscapes.
